newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Salim Group to float BCA, Indomobil.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Salim Group to float BCA, Indomobil.

text.p: Indonesia's huge Salim Group plans to float wholly-owned PT Bank Central Asia (BCA) and automobile manufacturing division PT Indomobil, the Jakarta Post reported on Saturday.
The newspaper quoted Benny Santoso, a senior executive in the group, as saying Indomobil would be floated later this year while BCA, the country's largest private bank, would be listed next year.
He said that other companies in the group, including those in its plantations and distribution divisions, would also be floated but no plans had yet been finalised.
Indomobil is Indonesia's third-largest automobile manufacture while BCA had assets of 35.26 trillion rupiah at the end of 1996 against 25.94 trillion rupiah at the end of 1995.

The group's major listed companies include PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa and food giant PT Indofood Sukses Makmur. Earlier this year, Indocement announced it was transferring its majority stake in Indofood to Singapore-based QAF Ltd, another group company.
The move drew sharp criticism from many Indonesians, who said it would lead to an outflow of capital from the country, but the government has said it backs the move.
